snippet: Strides in reproductive health, pay and literacy are noted, but the world’s poorest countries have not kept up, the report finds.
abstract: United Nations report finds that women worldwide have fewer children, are less likely to die of childbirth and have made great strides in literacy 20 years after it called on countries around the world to allow women greater control over their health and destiny; notes that world's poorest countries have not kept up.
lead_paragraph: Strides in reproductive health, pay and literacy are noted, but the world’s poorest countries have not kept up, the report finds.

headline.main: U.N. Report Says Progress for Women Is Unequal
headline.print_headline: U.N. Report Says Progress for Women Is Unequal

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
